selected_quotes: Growing out of it? An 8 year follow-up study finds that childhood anxiety disorders may improve without treatment.
Niños con ansiedad mejoran más sin tratmiento q con psicoterapia. Cuánto se daña en salud mental vía @JoannaMoncrieff
Study suggests CBT for children with anxiety may be no more effective than allowing anxiety to remit over time!
Eight years later: outcomes of CBT-treated versus untreated anxious children many children improve without treatmnt

citation.abstract: Anxiety disorders are the most common psychiatric disorders of childhood, generate significant distress, are considered precursors to diverse psychiatric disorders, and lead to poor social and employment outcomes in adulthood. Although childhood anxiety has a significant impact on a child's developmental trajectory, only a handful of studies examined the long-term impact of treatment and none included a control group. The aim of this study was to conduct a long-term follow-up (LTFU) of anxious children who were treated with Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy (CBT) compared to a matched group of children who were not.
citation.title: Eight years later: outcomes of CBT‐treated versus untreated anxious children

blogs.title: Nontreatment Better than CBT for Childhood Anxiety?
blogs.summary: Children who received no treatment for their diagnosed anxiety disorder faired better over the long term than did those who chose to take Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT), according to a study in Brain and Behavior. In addition, regardless of being treat
